content:
Netizen submissions
On July 7, the Weibo topic "The canteens within the system gave me the motivation to take the civil service exam" triggered netizens' dissatisfaction with the treatment of canteens within the system, and even caused dissatisfaction among patriotic big Vs and the different treatments of different units within the system. The topic then disappeared

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
Netizen contribution
Recently, a conversation between a Chengdu cyclist and a traffic policeman sparked heated discussions among netizens
In the video, a traffic policeman stopped a cyclist who was pushing a bicycle, believing that it was a vehicle and could not walk on the sidewalk unless he carried the bicycle.
"I'm pushing it like this..."
"You can't do that"
"(I'm pushing it) is still a vehicle? Are you sure?"
"Sure! Handsome man, what is yours if it's not a vehicle? Unless you carry it on your shoulder..."
"I'm a pedestrian only if I carry it on my shoulder?"
"I'm walking only if you carry it on your shoulder. You call it a car, is it a car? Handsome man"
"It's a car, but am I a pedestrian if I'm pushing it?"
"Okay, that's right, pedestrians walk as pedestrians, and cars can only be on the street"

User submissions
On July 7, the Cyberspace Administration of China proposed to prohibit the creation of topics and groups that publish negative content through anonymous submissions.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: Just now, Zhihu announced that it will shut down the "anonymous function"

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: On July 7, the internet reported that "Zhengzhou spent 3.4 billion yuan to dry-hang marble tiles on the river", which aroused doubts from netizens. The local Urban and Rural Construction Bureau said that it had paid attention to the doubts and was holding a meeting to discuss the issue.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
Netizen contribution
Under a video titled "Hua Chunying responds to Chinese netizens' disappointment"
100,000 netizens called out to Hua Chunying: I hope you can treat your compatriots well.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
A netizen submitted a post saying that after Japanese illustrators joined Weibo, a large number of Weibo users sent private messages to the illustrators to popularize the "July 7 Marco Polo Bridge" incident and asked them to express their views.
On July 7, the illustrators posted tweets on the "July 7 Incident", thanking the netizens and hoping that everyone would become good neighbors in the future.
